channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: RGB LED Could Be the Future for Cheap Screens
item.description: With incredible colors, brightness, and contrast, RGB backlighting is the technology that will drive the next 10 years of innovation in televisions an...

item.title: Google is replacing Google Assistant with Gemini
item.description: Google will replace Google Assistant on Android phones with Gemini later this year, the company announced on Friday. Google said in a blog post that i...

item.title: Under Trump, AI Scientists Are Told to Remove ‘Ideological Bias’ From Powerful Models
item.description: A directive from the National Institute of Standards and Technology eliminates mention of “AI safety” and “AI fairness.”

item.title: Bench is charging people for services they already paid for, some customers say
item.description: Bench customers say they're being required to pay for services they already paid for. Bench's new owners deny it. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserv...

item.title: Canadian Devs Are Backing Out of Attending GDC
item.description: Amid deteriorating relations between the US and Canada, many Canadian video game developers are opting not to travel to San Francisco for next week’s ...

item.title: AI coding assistant Cursor reportedly tells a ‘vibe coder’ to write his own damn code
item.description: As businesses race to replace humans with AI agents, coding assistant Cursor just gave a peek at the attitude bots could bring to work, too. © 2024 Te...

item.title: Profitable Klarna files for a potentially blockbuster IPO
item.description: Swedish fintech Klarna took the next step in its highly anticipated U.S. IPO on Friday when it made its F-1 public. Here are the top take-aways. © 202...

item.title: Republican Congressman Jim Jordan asks Big Tech if Biden tried to censor AI
item.description: On Thursday, House Judiciary Chair Jim Jordan (R-OH) sent letters to 16 American technology firms, including Google and OpenAI, asking for past commun...

item.title: Meta Tries to Bury a Tell-All Book
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg might be in his post-fact-checking-era. But that hasn’t stopped Meta from going after the author of Careless People.

item.title: Sun Home Luminar Sauna Review: No Steam
item.description: For $10,000, you get a small, warm room with a sound system and party lights!
